pages.title: ℧ Six of Cups ℧
pages.text: Spirit of Pleasure$(br)      ☉ Sun in ♏ Scorpio

In an old garden behind a manor, a child offers a cup to their friend, while another cup is behind them.$(br)  Four cups filled with flowers adorn the foreground, standing in a neat arrangement; they bring back a sense of peace and order to the suit.$(br)  A card of nostalgia and of memories, looking back, as - for example - on childhood.$(br)  Memories are blurred by watery emotion, and sentimentality, leaving them with a quality of quiet

dreaminess that can lead to docility.$(br)  Some elements of this card remind us of the past cards in the suit, reinterpreted and juxtaposed together. $(br2)$(l)Divinatory meanings$()$(br)  Memories. Especially of childhood.$(br)  Nostalgia, sometimes sentimentality.$(br2)$(l)Reversed$()$(br)  Looking ahead instead of backwards. Renewal.
An honest appraisal of the past, particularly childhood.$(br)  Stripping away of illusions.
